lines: Mom has just taken a job that requires her to be away in the morning and early afternoon. She decides to enroll you in a nursery school program. When you get there, you are greeted by a lady with very skinny legs and large, round glasses.

There are children playing with buckets of sand, building blocks and toys. There is a small girl sitting in a corner with tears streaming from her eyes. She has a runny nose, and red cheeks from crying.

Your excitement is a positive sign. You are trying to adapt to a new environment. You realize that your mom will be coming back, so you attempt to make friends. In the sandbox you see a little boy your age playing with a bucket and a red
shovel. What would you like to say to him?

The little boy ignores you. You are a newcomer to the social order of the nursery school. You are invading his territory. Your attempts at being sociable show potential, however. At very young ages, children are more likely to play
BESIDE one another than WITH one another.
The little boy interprets this as a threat to his territory. He holds the toys close to his body. You can:

In time this boy might respond to you, but you are still too new and too threatening. Giving him space is likely to stimulate his curiosity about you. By next week you will be playing nicely. You will have made a new friend.
The boy shakes his head back and forth. He wants no part of you.
Mommy has some nerve, getting a job and palming you off on this nursery school! The lady with the skinny legs tries to calm you down. You can:
The more she tries to "shhhh" you, the louder you wail. Every once in a while you let out a heart-wrenching, "Maaaaaaaaaa!" for dramatic effect. Nicely done. You can:

The lady with the skinny legs has nerves of steel. Her ability to withstand the crying is greater than your energy to keep crying. Her secret is that she is extremely hard of hearing. You are eventually put next to a cry-baby boy, where
you can be free to exchange techniques.
After you calm down, you realize that this really isn't so bad after all. For the rest of the day you keep yourself busy. When Mom comes back, you act as if you've barely missed her at all.

What a nasty little girl! I'll bet you chose this because you thought you might hit her. She avoids your kick and places you firmly on the floor. Next, she reads you the riot act. You WILL behave appropriately. There will be NO kicking.
Misbehavior will be dealt with severely. This lady is all business. They don't call her "Old Ironshins" for nothing!
